description: Join The Bottle Factory and Kaymet for a tour bringing urban industry on Old Kent Road to life. Meet the creative community of makers based at The Bottle Factory – a lovingly-restored Victorian warehouse quarter – including London’s oldest gin-distilling family. And visit the Kaymet factory, proud makers of hand-made anodised aluminium design classics since 1947, just a few doors down.

events.name: Tour of Bottle Factory and local makers
events.notes: A free walking tour of the history, makers and creatives of the Bottle Factory and local makers in and around the Old Kent Road.

events.name: Tour of Bottle Factory and local makers
events.notes: A free walking tour of the history, makers and creatives of the Bottle Factory and local makers in and around the Old Kent Road.

facilities: Handrails on both sides of stairs

factsheet.heading: THE BOTTLE FACTORY
paragraphs: The Bottle Factory, located just off Old Kent Road, is a restored Victorian warehouse complex with a rich history as a bottling factory. Originally built in 1895, it was home to J. Mills & Sons, a well-known London bottling company specializing in mineral water, lemonade, and ginger beer. The factory operated for nearly a century before being repurposed by London-based developer Fabrix. Today, it serves as a vibrant hub for creatives, makers, and urban industry businesses, while retaining its industrial heritage.

factsheet.heading: KAYMET
paragraphs: Kaymet are producers of aluminium trays, trolleys and electric table hotplates - classic designs that have evolved over the years, and feel fresher today than ever.
The company has been proudly hand-making anodised aluminium ware in London since 1947 and was granted a Royal Warrant of Appointment to Her Majesty The Queen in 2018.
The items, still hand-made in the  factory today, sell in a collection of wonderful shops around the world, including London's finest department store.

factsheet.heading: ABOUT THE TOUR
paragraphs: The tour will bring the history of manufacture and design on Old Kent Road to life, though the lens of the growing number of present-day makers based on Ossory Road, just south of Burgess Park.

We'll hear from London-based developer Fabrix about the history of The Bottle Factory as a Victorian lemonade factory, as well as their approach to its sensitive restoration as home to a new community of makers, creatives and urban industry stalwarts.

You'll have the chance to visit the rich mix of makers now based on site, from London's oldest gin-distilling family Thames Distillers to the capital's most sustainable, all-electric coffee roastery The London Coffee Company, and design-led bio-based paint manufacturer Atelier Ellis, as well as a host of other creatives.
After The Bottle Factory, we'll wander further down Ossory Road to tour the Kaymet Factory - makers of anodised aluminium design classics - and the London Stone Company.

travel_info:
Additional travel info: The end point of the tour will be Kaymet which is:

Kaymet Works, 52 Ossory Rd, London SE1 5AN

name: Bottle Factory and makers on the Old Kent Road tours
